intro: Barthea barthei var. formosana, commonly known as the Formosan barthea, is a rare and unique plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
